intro: Hieracium subornatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium subornatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
